command.name: armF
command.desc: Unused. Forces a weapon into an arms slot.

arg.desc: The slot to overwrite.
The weapon to change the slot into. Valid inputs are 'Bean', 'Wide', 'Bubble', 'Fire', 'Kurob', 'Rocket' (unused), and 'ArmsX' (unused, crashes the game when fired).
The level of the weapon, minus 1. 0 = Level 1, 1 = Level 2, etc.

command.name: armS
command.desc: Unused. Forces a weapon into an arms slot, and forces the player to select it.

arg.desc: The slot to overwrite.
The weapon to change the slot into. Valid inputs are 'Bean', 'Wide', 'Bubble', 'Fire', 'Kurob', 'Rocket' (unused), and 'ArmsX' (unused, crashes the game when fired).
The level of the weapon, minus 1. 0 = Level 1, 1 = Level 2, etc.

command.name: blln
command.desc: Creates a speech balloon pointing towards an NPC, and makes all future text print inside the balloon.

arg.desc: The data label of the NPC to point at. When set to a data label not in the level, no balloon appears.
The type of text box. 0 = Regular, Anything else = Exclamation

command.name: bllR
command.desc: Removes the speech balloon.

command.name: bnsD
command.desc: Makes it so that coins now fall through semi-solid platforms.

command.name: cage
command.desc: Prevents the player from going off-screen.

arg.desc: How it should work. 0 = Turn off cage, 1 = Stop the player slightly off-screen, 2 = Prevent the player from going off-screen at all.

command.name: call
command.desc: Jumps to a label, then after it hits an 'exit' command it returns to right after this command.

arg.desc: Which label to jump to.

command.name: camp
command.desc: Takes the player to a temporary room, usually a shop. When the player leaves that room, they come back to where they entered.

arg.desc: The filename of the room to enter.
The point to appear at when entering the room.
The label in the script to run when entering the room.

command.name: chgN
command.desc: Changes an NPC to one of a few script-exclusive entities.

arg.desc: The data label of the NPCs that are desired to be changed.
The entity to change into. If set to '-' then it is determined by the NPC's data label.

command.name: chkP
command.desc: Unkown. Seems to be used to send the player to a hospital when the player gets a game over?

arg.desc: The filename of the room to enter.
The point to appear at when entering the room.
Unknown. Always set to '1' in the game's scripts.

command.name: cler
command.desc: Erases all text onscreen.

command.name: cont
command.desc: Unused. Does nothing, seems to be dummied out.

command.name: crdG
command.desc: Displays a section of the credits.

arg.desc: The section of the credits to display. 0 = The mini Kero Blaster logo.

command.name: crdt
command.desc: Displays credits, scrolling them from the bottom to the top of the screen.

arg.desc: Which credits to display. Only 1 works.

command.name: cRsv
command.desc: It seems like in situations where 'call' doesn't work, use this.

arg.desc: Which label to jump to.

command.name: curN
command.desc: Select an NPC label, which can be used later in another NPC-related command by using '-' as the label.

arg.desc: The NPC label to select.

command.name: dely
command.desc: Delay for a given amount of frames.

arg.desc: Time measured in 1/60th of a second.

command.name: dirN
command.desc: Changes the alternate direction/skin flag of all NPCs with a certain data label.

arg.desc: The data label of the NPCs that are desired to be changed.
The direction to choose. 0 = Left/Normal, 1 = Right/Alternate

command.name: dl20
command.desc: Delay for 20 frames (1/3rd of a second).

command.name: dl60
command.desc: Delay for 60 frames (1 second).

command.name: drug
command.desc: Enter the health shop.

arg.desc: Which script label to jump to after exiting the shop.

command.name: dsSv
command.desc: Removes all the player's health and lives, then saves the game. When the save file is reloaded, the player has three lives.

command.name: exit
command.desc: Ends the script.

command.name: fadC
command.desc: Fade out towards the center of the screen.

command.name: fadE
command.desc: Creates a white flash starting at a certain spot. The 'E' stands for explosion.

arg.desc: How many tiles away from the left side of the screen the explosion starts.
How many tiles away from the top of the screen the explosion starts.
The type of explosion. 0 explodes across all diagonal directions. Anything else is a screen-wide horizontal beam.

command.name: fadF
command.desc: Create a window that focuses on a certain spot, that goes away after pushing a button. The 'F' stands for focus.

arg.desc: How many tiles away from the left side of the screen it is.
How many tiles away from the top of the screen it is.
How large the window should be.

command.name: fadI
command.desc: Empties the screen of black, such as in level transitions.

command.name: fadO
command.desc: Fills the screen with black.

command.name: fcsC
command.desc: Unused. Completely breaks the script system, DO NOT USE.

command.name: fcsH
command.desc: Fixes the camera's horizontal position to be centered on the first-placed anchor in the level. Can also be triggered using an event with data label 'fcsH'.

arg.desc: Whether to snap immediately or not(?)

command.name: fcsM
command.desc: The default camera. Can also be triggered using an event with data label 'fcsM'.

arg.desc: Whether to snap immediately or not(?)

command.name: fcsN
command.desc: Focus the camera on a certain labelled NPC.

arg.desc: The data label of the NPC you want the camera to follow.
Whether to snap immediately or not(?)

command.name: fcsO
command.desc: The camera used in some areas with lots of slopes. Can also be triggered using an event with data label 'fcsO'.

arg.desc: Whether to snap immediately or not(?)

command.name: fcsU
command.desc: Forces the camera to focus underneath the player. Can also be triggered using an event with data label 'fcsU'.

arg.desc: Whether to snap immediately or not(?)

command.name: fcsV
command.desc: Fixes the camera's vertical position to be centered on the first-placed anchor in the level. Can also be triggered using an event with data label 'fcsV'.

arg.desc: Whether to snap immediately or not(?)

command.name: flag
command.desc: Sets a certain special flag, represented by a string.

arg.desc: The label of the flag to be changed. (list as of 1.0.6.3) Black = Omake Mode, ShowTA = Show the time attack clock, TimeAttack = Flag set by Time Attack seemingly just for internal purposes, HeartHike = Increase price of hearts in Drug Store like in stages 5-7 in the final game, Jacket = Jackets spawn in shop and hospital like in stage 5...
What to set the flag to. 0 = Clear the flag, Anything else = Set

command.name: fldQ
command.desc: Makes an earthquake.

arg.desc: The duration of the tremor, in 1/60ths of a second.
Not sure. Maybe the resistance?.

command.name: fldS
command.desc: Automatically scrolls a layer horizontally, like on the train in Stage 6.

arg.desc: The layer to scroll. 0 = Foreground, 1 = Middleground, 2 = Background
The scrolling speed. Positive numbers scroll left, while negative numbers scroll right.

command.name: flgC
command.desc: Clears a certain number of flags, starting with a particular one.

arg.desc: The amount of flags to clear.
The flag to start at.

command.name: flgF
command.desc: Unused. Completely breaks the script system, DO NOT USE.

arg.desc: Might have been flag to set back when it still worked.

command.name: flgI
command.desc: Clears all flags.

command.name: flgM
command.desc: Clears a flag, unless it is already cleared.

arg.desc: The flag to clear.

command.name: flgO
command.desc: Jumps to a label based off whether a flag is set.

arg.desc: The flag to read.
The label to jump to.

command.name: flgP
command.desc: Sets a flag, unless it is already set.

arg.desc: The flag to set.

command.name: flgR
command.desc: Flips a flag.

arg.desc: The flag to flip. 0 becomes 1, and 1 becomes 0.

command.name: flsh
command.desc: Flashes the screen white rapidly twice.

command.name: free
command.desc: When run, releases the player from the frez command. Only used in shop scripts, which are forced to be run by the game itself.

command.name: frez
command.desc: Prevents the text and script from progressing. Do not use outside of a shop script, as there is no way to get out of it other than quitting the game.

command.name: full
command.desc: Only used in a single cutscene. Doesn't seem to do anything.

command.name: gaug
command.desc: Creates a boss health bar for a single NPC. Running this command while one is already out will make it disappear

arg.desc: The data label of the NPC.

The type of boss bar. 0 = No health bar. 1 = Top of the screen. 2 = Bottom of the screen. 3 = Bottom left of the screen. (used in Clock Man fight) Anything else = Top right of the screen, barely visible.

command.name: govr
command.desc: Triggers a game over.

command.name: grUp
command.desc: Enter the weapon upgrade shop.

arg.desc: Which script label to jump to after exiting the shop.

command.name: hide
command.desc: Unused. Does nothing, seems to be dummied out.

command.name: hito
command.desc: Used only in the 'parking' rooms of Stage 4 in Normal and Zangyou mode. Seems to do nothing.

command.name: home
command.desc: Opens the file selection menu.

command.name: isla
command.desc: Unused. Enters the stage select.

arg.desc: The script from 'island.pxeve' to run.
Unknown. Seems to have something to do with reentering a level?

command.name: isPh
command.desc: Unused. Determines what the player's ship does on the world map.

arg.desc: The player's action. The only ones used in-game are 'flight' and 'action'

command.name: isUC
command.desc: Unused. Clears all island NPCs.

command.name: isUF
command.desc: Unused. Spawns an island NPC if a flag is set.

arg.desc: Which flag to check.
The entity to spawn. Valid inputs are 'myship', 'lambark', 'saucer', 'peke', 'scope', and 'bom'.
Which level to spawn it at.
Which state to spawn the NPC with.

command.name: isUn
command.desc: Unused. Spawns an island NPC that does something.

arg.desc: The entity to spawn. Valid inputs are 'myship', 'lambark', 'saucer', 'peke', 'scope', and 'bom'.
Which level to start at.
Which level the NPC travels to.
Which state to spawn the NPC with.

command.name: jmpA
command.desc: Unused. Jumps to a label if the player has a certain weapon.

arg.desc: The weapon to check for.
Which label to jump to.

command.name: jmpC
command.desc: Jumps to a label if a number of flags, starting with a certain one, are set.

arg.desc: The starting flag.
The amount of flags to check.
Which label to jump to.

command.name: jmpD
command.desc: Jump to a label if the player is dead.

arg.desc: Which label to jump to.

command.name: jmpF
command.desc: Jump to a label if a flag is set.

arg.desc: Which flag to check.
Which label to jump to.

command.name: jmpG
command.desc: Jump to a label if a game-wide flag is set.

arg.desc: Which game flag to check.
Which label to jump to.

command.name: jmpI
command.desc: Jump to a label if the player has a certain item.

arg.desc: Which item to check for.
Which label to jump to.

command.name: jmpM
command.desc: Unused. Seems to be a clone of 'jump', but a number needs to be specified.

arg.desc: Which flag to check.
Which label to jump to.

command.name: jmpP
command.desc: Unused. Seems to be a clone of 'jump'.

arg.desc: Which label to jump to.

command.name: jmpS
command.desc: Brings up a selection menu with two customizable options, then either jumps to a label or continues the script depending on your choice.

arg.desc: What the first option should say.
What the second option should say.
Which label to jump to if you choose the second option..
Doesn't seem to matter. Always set to 1 in the scripts used in the vanilla game.

command.name: jump
command.desc: Jump to a label.

arg.desc: Which label to jump to.

command.name: ldIm
command.desc: Loads an image into the NPC palette.

arg.desc: Which indexed palette .PNG image to load.

command.name: life
command.desc: Increase or decrease the player's health.

arg.desc: The amount of health to add, or subtract if it's negative.

command.name: lifm
command.desc: Increase or decrease the player's maximum health.

arg.desc: The amount of maximum health to add, or subtract if it's negative.

command.name: lkFU
command.desc: Locks the player in place for a bit, or until set to 0.

arg.desc: How to lock the player's. 0 = Unlock, 1 = Lock for a little bit, 2 = Lock forever, 3 = seems to be a clone of 2?

command.name: lump
command.desc: I'm not sure what this is for. It seems to make the text disappear on it's own? It's only used in the arms shop.

command.name: mapc
command.desc: Loads (tileset)-.png instead of (tileset).png when loaded with a special flag set. This is only used in Stage 7 with Omake mode in the final game.

arg.desc: The flag to load. Not a number, but rather a string from a hardcoded list of flags.

command.name: mapR
command.desc: Replaces the room the player is currently in, but the entities stay the same.

arg.desc: The filename of the room to enter.
The room you're in when running this script.
Doesn't seem to matter. Always set to 1 in the scripts used in the vanilla game.

command.name: mony
command.desc: Increase or decrease the player's money.

arg.desc: The amount of money to add, or subtract if it's negative.

command.name: muCo
command.desc: Continues a music track from when it was stopped with 'muSt', fading in across a certain number of frames.

arg.desc: The time to fade in the music, measured in 1/60th of a second.

command.name: muFO
command.desc: Fades out a music track across a certain number of frames.

arg.desc: The time to fade out the music, measured in 1/60th of a second.

command.name: muLd
command.desc: Load a music track for playing.

arg.desc: The filename of the .ptcop file to load.

command.name: muLp
command.desc: Play the .ptcop file loaded by a previous muLd command.

command.name: muOc
command.desc: Plays the .ptcop file loaded by a muLd once.

command.name: muWS
command.desc: Similar to 'dely', but only while playing a music track.

arg.desc: Time measured in 1/60th of a second.

command.name: namA
command.desc: Unused, seemingly does nothing.

command.name: namI
command.desc: Displays the name of an item. Seems to only work properly in the shop script.

arg.desc: The name of the item.

command.name: ncon
command.desc: Unused except in Pink Hour and Pink Heaven. Makes it so that the file select screen doesn't bring up the last loaded save file.

command.name: newA
command.desc: Gives the player a new weapon or item, shows its description, then jumps to a label.

arg.desc: The weapon to give the player, from a hardcoded list.
The label to jump to in the script.

command.name: newE
command.desc: Usage unknown. Prevents the level from loading.

command.name: nodB
command.desc: Stops the text, then continues and clears the speech balloon after you push a button.

command.name: nodc
command.desc: Stops the text, then continues right when you push a button.

command.name: nodE
command.desc: Unused. Stops the text, then stops running the script when you push a button.

command.name: nxtl
command.desc: Moves the text printing location down one line.

command.name: pkup
command.desc: Gives the player an item or weapon. If the player already has a weapon, it gets upgraded.

arg.desc: The item or weapon you want to obtain.
Doesn't seem to matter.

command.name: plAc
command.desc: Changes the player's action. For most actions, they must be reverted to the 'nrml' action to be stopped.

arg.desc: The action the player character does, from a hard-coded list of strings.

command.name: plDi
command.desc: Changes the player's direction.

arg.desc: The direction to look. 0 = Left, 1 = Right, Anything else = Player faces right, jetpack faces left

command.name: plEq
command.desc: Toggles whether the player's weapon disappears and become unusable, i.e. in the hospital. Resets after entering another room

arg.desc: 0 = No weapon, Anything else = Weapon

command.name: plMv
command.desc: Pushes the player with a certain horizontal force and vertical force.

arg.desc: The horizontal force. Negative numbers push you left, positive numbers push you right.
The vertical force. Negative numbers push you up, positive numbers push you down.

command.name: plPo
command.desc: Puts the player at the position of a certain entity.

arg.desc: The data label of the entity to teleport the player to.

command.name: plSt
command.desc: Stops the player's momentum.

command.name: posN
command.desc: Teleports all NPCs of a certain data label to an NPC of another label

arg.desc: The data label of the NPCs that are desired to be moved.
The data label of the NPC that serves as the teleport location.
Doesn't seem to matter.

command.name: prm2
command.desc: Changes the Parameter 2/Variant of an NPC.

arg.desc: The data label of the NPCs that are desired to be changed.
What to set Variant/Param2 to.

command.name: qOK_
command.desc: Pauses the game and makes a selection box that says 'OK' appear. It only shows up properly in a shop screen.

command.name: quie
command.desc: I'm not sure what this does. It's used in the scene where Mizutani-san/Kajiya activates Omake Mode.

command.name: regT
command.desc: Displays a special string from memory. Only uses in the arms shop.

arg.desc: Which number string to display.

command.name: rema
command.desc: Increase or decrease the player's extra lives.

arg.desc: The amount of lives to add, or subtract if it's negative.

command.name: remD
command.desc: Forces the player to have three extra lives total.

command.name: remR
command.desc: Unused. Seems to do nothing.

command.name: repo
command.desc: Prints a message in the debug log.

arg.desc: The message to output.

command.name: rmvB
command.desc: Unused. Does nothing, seems to be dummied out.

command.name: rmvN
command.desc: Delete all NPCs with a certain label.

arg.desc: The data label of the unwanted NPCs.

command.name: save
command.desc: Saves the game right then and there.

command.name: scrF
command.desc: Turns off the UI and shifts the view downward to fill the space.

arg.desc: 0 = Show UI, Anything else = Hide UI

command.name: sftN
command.desc: Shift all NPCs with a certain data label a certain amount of tiles horizonatlly and vertically.

arg.desc: The data label of the NPCs that are desired to be moved.
The amount to shift horizontally. Negative numbers are left, positive numbers are right.
The amount to shift vertically. Negative numbers are up, positive numbers are down.

command.name: shoR
command.desc: Return to the map and position you last entered the shop.

arg.desc: Which script label to jump to.

command.name: shwS
command.desc: Makes the player's lives, coins, weapons, etc. on the UI invisible, and puts a white Kero Blaster logo on the corner.

arg.desc: 0 = On, 1 = Off.

command.name: sign
command.desc: Only used in the shop, seemingly to tell the game code to upgrade the player's weapon.

arg.desc: Unknown. Only set to '1' in the scripts in the vanilla game.

command.name: skip
command.desc: When the Skip flag is set (i.e. after beating the game), jumps to an event after pressing the escape key.

arg.desc: Which label to jump to.

command.name: skLT
command.desc: Presumably sets something. Only used on the title screen..

arg.desc: Unknown. Probably turns it on and off?

command.name: skpE
command.desc: Jumps to an event set by a 'skip' command, even when the Skip flag isn't set.

arg.desc: Which label to jump to.

command.name: slPo
command.desc: Forces the player to face right. Meant for elevator doors.

command.name: slPu
command.desc: Unknown usage. Meant for exiting elevator doors, but I don't see any difference with or without this.

command.name: soul
command.desc: Sound loop. Indefinitely loops a sound until the next sous command.

arg.desc: The .ptnoise file to loop.

command.name: sous
command.desc: Stops the sound loop. (Warning: Some sounds might be unable to be stopped, like boost)

arg.desc: The .ptnoise loop to stop.

command.name: souv
command.desc: Play a sound once

arg.desc: The .ptnoise file to play.

command.name: stgR
command.desc: Restarts the stage(?)

command.name: stgS
command.desc: Sets the current stage number.

arg.desc: The stage number to change to.

command.name: stop
command.desc: Stops running any and all scripts. Not recommended to be used, as the game still thinks it's running a script so it won't let you pause, forcing you to turn the game off through other means.

command.name: swtN
command.desc: Switches an entity's state/animation. Freezes most NPCs, but has special properties for a few objects like bosses and cutscene characters.

arg.desc: The data label of the NPCs that are desired to be changed.
The state to change the entity to.

command.name: taBe
command.desc: Start the time attack timer from 0.

command.name: taFi
command.desc: Finishes the time attack timer.

command.name: taJm
command.desc: If the finished time attack score is a high score, jumps to a label.

arg.desc: Which label to jump to.

command.name: taRe
command.desc: Resumes the time attack timer.

command.name: taSt
command.desc: Pauses the time attack timer.

command.name: taSv
command.desc: Saves the time attack high score to the save file

command.name: taZe
command.desc: Blanks out the time attack timer.

command.name: titl
command.desc: Enters the title screen. In other words, reset the game.

command.name: trD2
command.desc: Takes the player to one of the rooms defines as that room's level exit.

arg.desc: The room to enter from this room's level exits. 'l' means the left exit, 'r' means the right exit, 'u' means the up exit, 'd' means the down exit.
The point to appear at when entering the room.

command.name: trIn
command.desc: Brings the player to the intro of the stage, leading to the first room.

command.name: trL2
command.desc: Takes the player to one of the rooms defines as that room's level exit.

arg.desc: The room to enter from this room's level exits. 'l' means the left exit, 'r' means the right exit, 'u' means the up exit, 'd' means the down exit.
The point to appear at when entering the room.

command.name: trns
command.desc: Takes the player to a room.

arg.desc: The filename of the room to enter.
The point to appear at when entering the room.
The label in the script to run when entering the room.

command.name: trR2
command.desc: Takes the player to one of the rooms defines as that room's level exit.

arg.desc: The room to enter from this room's level exits. 'l' means the left exit, 'r' means the right exit, 'u' means the up exit, 'd' means the down exit.
The point to appear at when entering the room.

command.name: trU2
command.desc: Takes the player to one of the rooms defines as that room's level exit.

arg.desc: The room to enter from this room's level exits. 'l' means the left exit, 'r' means the right exit, 'u' means the up exit, 'd' means the down exit.
The point to appear at when entering the room.

command.name: txtP
command.desc: Decide the location of the text being displayed.

arg.desc: How many spaces away from the left side of the screen the text should be printed.
How many spaces away from the top of the screen the text should be printed.

command.name: txtV
command.desc: Unused. Manually decides the sound of the voice playing.

arg.desc: Which text voice sound effect should play. 0 = Unused evil-sounding voice, 1 = Typewriter (1.5) or Regular (1.0.6.3), 2 = Regular (1.5) or Female (1.0.6.3), 3 = Female (1.5) or No Voice (1.0.6.3), Anything else = No voice.

command.name: txtW
command.desc: Unused. Decides how long to wait after hitting a space in text, which is halved when holding a button.

arg.desc: The amount of time to wait, in 1/60ths of a second.

command.name: vfEn
command.desc: Used in a few rooms that have bosses. I'm not sure what this does. Maybe something to do with the 'vflg' command?

command.name: vflg
command.desc: Manually set or clear a flag.

arg.desc: Which flag to modify.
What to set it to. Either 0 or 1.

command.name: whtI
command.desc: Empties the screen of white.

command.name: whtO
command.desc: Fills the screen with white, like when you obtain an item.

command.name: wtCr
command.desc: Unused. Stops running the script, but doesn't properly end it, forcing the game to be turned off by external means.

command.name: wtFc
command.desc: Waits for the game to finish scrolling over to a focus object.

command.name: wtNB
command.desc: Waits for an entity to reach a certain state. Only seems to work on story elevators(?)

arg.desc: The entity to check the state of.
The state to check for. If not this state, the game will continue waiting.
